## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

| CURRENCY                          |   RATE |
|:----------------------------------|-------:|
| USD PKR Interbank Selling / Jan 6 | 228.15 |
| USD PKR Interbank Buying / Jan 6  | 227.15 |
| USD to Japanese Yen / Jan 6       | 132.08 |
| USD to Swiss Franc / Jan 6        |   0.93 |
| Pound Sterling to USD / Jan 6     |   1.21 |
| Euro to USD / Jan 6               |   1.06 |
| UK LIBOR % / Jan 6                |   4.32 |

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(gt)
library(gtExtras)
library(kableExtra)
Currency<-c("USD PKR Interbank Selling / Jan 6",

"USD PKR Interbank Buying / Jan 6",

"USD to Japanese Yen / Jan 6",

"USD to Swiss Franc / Jan 6",

"Pound Sterling to USD / Jan 6",

"Euro to USD / Jan 6",

"UK LIBOR % / Jan 6")

Rate<-c(228.15,227.15,132.08,0.93,1.21,1.06,4.32)

table<-bind_cols(Currency, Rate)
table<-table|>rename(CURRENCY="...1", RATE="...2")
table |> gt()|>gt_theme_guardian()|>tab_caption("FOREX, Source:BR")
table |> gt()|>gt_theme_538()|>tab_caption("FOREX, Source:BR")
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
